before_script: sudo iptables -L DOCKER || sudo iptables -N DOCKER
chef exec bundle exec overcommit --sign pre-commit
script: travis_retry chef exec bundle exec rake integration:docker[${INSTANCE}]

engine_cmd_compile: . /scripts/toolchains/osx/osx-build-env.sh &&  go build -ldflags "-X main.goos=darwin -X main.goarch=amd64" -o capsulecd-darwin-amd64 -tags "static" $(go list ./cmd/...)
. /scripts/toolchains/linux/linux-build-env.sh && go build -ldflags "-X main.goos=linux -X main.goarch=amd64" -o capsulecd-linux-amd64 -tags "static" $(go list ./cmd/...)

run.name: Install dependencies
run.command:
env
docker info
apk --update-cache --allow-untrusted \
    add go build-base bash curl \
    && rm -rf /var/cache/apk/*

mkdir -p /coverage

# Configure Go
mkdir -p ${GOPATH}/src ${GOPATH}/bin

docker pull analogj/libgit2-crossbuild:linux-amd64

run.name: Build application Docker image
run.command:
docker build -f ci/Dockerfile.base --tag analogj/capsulecd-ci:base .
docker build -f ci/Dockerfile.chef --tag analogj/capsulecd-ci:chef .
docker build -f ci/Dockerfile.node --tag analogj/capsulecd-ci:node .
docker build -f ci/Dockerfile.python --tag analogj/capsulecd-ci:python .
docker build -f ci/Dockerfile.ruby --tag analogj/capsulecd-ci:ruby .
docker build -f ci/Dockerfile.golang --tag analogj/capsulecd-ci:golang .

run.name: Run Base Docker containers with coverage
run.command:
CAPSULECD_ENV=base
echo "#################################################### $CAPSULECD_ENV"
docker run -e "CI=true" \
  --name $CAPSULECD_ENV \
  analogj/capsulecd-ci:$CAPSULECD_ENV \
  ./ci/test-coverage.sh $CAPSULECD_ENV

docker cp $CAPSULECD_ENV:/coverage/coverage-$CAPSULECD_ENV.txt /coverage

galaxy_info.description: Install and configure PostgreSQL, dependencies, extensions, databases and users.

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\configure.yml.command: {{ postgresql_bin_directory }}/initdb -D {{ postgresql_data_directory }} --locale={{ postgresql_locale }} --encoding={{ postgresql_encoding }} {% if postgresql_data_checksums and postgresql_version is version_compare('9.3', '>=') %}--data-checksums{% endif %} {% if postgresql_pwfile != "" %}--pwfile={{ postgresql_pwfile }} {% endif %} {% if postgresql_wal_directory != "" and postgresql_version is version_compare('10', '<') %}--xlogdir={{ postgresql_wal_directory }} {% endif %} {% if postgresql_wal_directory != "" and postgresql_version is version_compare('10', '>=') %}--waldir={{ postgresql_wal_directory }} {% endif %}
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\configure.yml.when: ansible_os_family == "RedHat" and (postgresql_cluster_reset or pgdata_dir_exist.changed or not pgdata_dir_initialized.stat.exists)

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\configure.yml.name: PostgreSQL | Verify postgresql cluster version
PostgreSQL | Ensure configuration directory exists
PostgreSQL | Update configuration - pt. 1 (pg_hba.conf)
PostgreSQL | Update configuration - pt. 2 (postgresql.conf)
PostgreSQL | Update configuration - pt. 3 (pgtune)
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\configure.yml.shell:
set -e
TMPDIR=$(mktemp -d)
pgtune --input-config=postgresql.conf.untuned\
       --output-config=$TMPDIR/postgresql.conf\
       {% if postgresql_pgtune_memory %}--memory {{postgresql_pgtune_memory|int}}{% endif %}\
       --type {{postgresql_pgtune_type|quote}}\
       {% if postgresql_pgtune_connections %}--connections {{postgresql_pgtune_connections|int}}{% endif %}\
# Compare the current config with the one procuded by pgtune (ignoring comments/blanks)
if diff --ignore-blank-lines \
    <(sed -e 's/#.*//' postgresql.conf) \
    <(sed -e 's/#.*//' $TMPDIR/postgresql.conf)
then
  echo '_OK_'
else
  cp $TMPDIR/postgresql.conf postgresql.conf
fi
# Cleanup
rm $TMPDIR/postgresql.conf
rmdir $TMPDIR

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\configure.yml.name: PostgreSQL | Update configuration - pt. 4 (pg_ident.conf)
PostgreSQL | Create folder for additional configuration files
PostgreSQL | Ensure the systemd directory for PostgreSQL exists | RedHat
PostgreSQL | Use the conf directory when starting the Postgres service | RedHat
PostgreSQL | Ensure the pid directory for PostgreSQL exists
PostgreSQL | Reload all conf files
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\configure.yml.when: postgresql_configuration_pt1.changed or postgresql_configuration_pt2.changed or postgresql_configuration_pt3.changed or postgresql_systemd_custom_conf.changed

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.name: PostgreSQL | Make sure the PostgreSQL databases are present
PostgreSQL | Add extensions to the databases
PostgreSQL | Add hstore to the databases with the requirement
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.shell: {{ postgresql_bin_directory}}/psql {{item.name}} --username {{postgresql_admin_user}} -c 'CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS hstore;'
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.failed_when: hstore_ext_result.rc != 0 and ("already exists, skipping" not in hstore_ext_result.stderr)
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.changed_when: hstore_ext_result.rc == 0 and ("already exists, skipping" not in hstore_ext_result.stderr)

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.name: PostgreSQL | Add uuid-ossp to the database with the requirement
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.failed_when: uuid_ext_result.rc != 0 and ("already exists, skipping" not in uuid_ext_result.stderr)
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.changed_when: uuid_ext_result.rc == 0 and ("already exists, skipping" not in uuid_ext_result.stderr)

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.name: PostgreSQL | Add postgis to the databases with the requirement
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.shell: {{ postgresql_bin_directory}}/psql {{item.name}} --username {{postgresql_admin_user}} -c 'CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS postgis;'&&psql {{item.name}} -c 'CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS postgis_topology;'

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.name: PostgreSQL | add cube to the database with the requirement
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.shell: {{ postgresql_bin_directory}}/psql {{item.name}} --username {{ postgresql_admin_user }} -c 'create extension if not exists cube;'

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.name: PostgreSQL | Add plpgsql to the database with the requirement
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.shell: {{ postgresql_bin_directory}}/psql {{item.name}} --username {{ postgresql_admin_user }} -c 'CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS plpgsql;'

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.name: PostgreSQL | add earthdistance to the database with the requirement
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.shell: {{ postgresql_bin_directory}}/psql {{item.name}} --username {{ postgresql_admin_user }} -c 'create extension if not exists earthdistance;'

ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.name: PostgreSQL | Add citext to the database with the requirement
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.shell: {{ postgresql_bin_directory}}/psql {{item.name}} --username {{postgresql_admin_user}} -c 'CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS citext;'
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.failed_when: citext_ext_result.rc != 0 and ("already exists, skipping" not in citext_ext_result.stderr)
ANXS/postgresql\\tasks\\databases.yml.changed_when: citext_ext_result.rc == 0 and ("already exists, skipping" not in citext_ext_result.stderr)

oc_erchef.command: --peer postgresql --bind bookshelf:bookshelf.default --bind oc_bifrost:oc_bifrost.default --bind database:postgresql.default --bind elasticsearch:elasticsearch5.default --bind chef-server-ctl:chef-server-ctl.default

environment.HAB_OC_ERCHEF:
[chef_authn]
keygen_cache_workers=2
keygen_cache_size=10
keygen_start_size=0
keygen_timeout=20000
[data_collector]
enabled = ${AUTOMATE_ENABLED:-false}
server = "${AUTOMATE_SERVER:-localhost}"
port = 443

chef-server-nginx.command: --peer postgresql --bind oc_erchef:oc_erchef.default --bind oc_bifrost:oc_bifrost.default --bind oc_id:oc_id.default --bind bookshelf:bookshelf.default --bind elasticsearch:elasticsearch5.default --bind chef-server-ctl:chef-server-ctl.default

schedules.name: nightly_build
schedules.description: Run a nightly build in the Jenkins pipeline

chef-server.description: Load up all the things used for most chef server dev: pedant, cookbooks, commands, erchef.  Starts oc_erchef without a console.

oc_erchef.description: Load up erchef and start it in console mode.

oc_bifrost.description: Load oc_bifrost and oc-bifrost-pedant from /host. Start oc_bifrost into a console.

messages.invalid_request: The request is missing a required parameter, includes an unsupported parameter value, or is otherwise malformed.

messages.access_denied: The resource owner or authorization server denied the request.

messages.server_error: The authorization server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.
messages.temporarily_unavailable: The authorization server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

messages.resource_owner_authenticator_not_configu: Resource Owner find failed due to Doorkeeper.configure.resource_owner_authenticator being unconfiged.

messages.unsupported_grant_type: The authorization grant type is not supported by the authorization server.
messages.invalid_resource_owner: The provided resource owner credentials are not valid, or resource owner cannot be found

changelog.rollup_header: Changes not yet released to rubygems.org
Changes not yet released to rubygems.org

Changes not yet released to rubygems.org

Layout/ClassStructure.Description: Enforces a configured order of definitions within a class body.

Layout/FirstArrayElementLineBreak.Description: Checks for a line break before the first element in a multi-line array.

Layout/FirstHashElementLineBreak.Description: Checks for a line break before the first element in a multi-line hash.

Layout/FirstMethodArgumentLineBreak.Description: Checks for a line break before the first argument in a multi-line method call.

Layout/FirstMethodParameterLineBreak.Description: Checks for a line break before the first parameter in a multi-line method parameter definition.

Layout/MultilineAssignmentLayout.Description: Check for a newline after the assignment operator in multi-line assignments.

Lint/NumberConversion.Description: Checks unsafe usage of number conversion methods.

Rails/SaveBang.Description: Identifies possible cases where Active Record save! or related should be used.

Style/AutoResourceCleanup.Description: Suggests the usage of an auto resource cleanup version of a method (if available).

Style/Copyright.Description: Include a copyright notice in each file before any code.

Layout/EmptyLineAfterGuardClause.Description: Add empty line after guard clause.

Style/ImplicitRuntimeError.Description: Use `raise` or `fail` with an explicit exception class and message, rather than just a message.

Style/MethodCallWithArgsParentheses.Description: Use parentheses for method calls with arguments.

Style/MethodCalledOnDoEndBlock.Description: Avoid chaining a method call on a do...end block.

Style/MissingElse.Description: Require if/case expressions to have an else branches. If enabled, it is recommended that Style/UnlessElse and Style/EmptyElse be enabled. This will conflict with Style/EmptyElse if Style/EmptyElse is configured to style "both"

Style/OptionHash.Description: Don't use option hashes when you can use keyword arguments.

Style/ReturnNil.Description: Use return instead of return nil.

Style/Send.Description: Prefer `Object#__send__` or `Object#public_send` to `send`, as `send` may overlap with existing methods.

Style/SingleLineBlockParams.Description: Enforces the names of some block params.

Style/StringHashKeys.Description: Prefer symbols instead of strings as hash keys.

Style/StringMethods.Description: Checks if configured preferred methods are used over non-preferred.

Bundler/DuplicatedGem.Description: Checks for duplicate gem entries in Gemfile.

Bundler/InsecureProtocolSource.Description: The source `:gemcutter`, `:rubygems` and `:rubyforge` are deprecated because HTTP requests are insecure. Please change your source to 'https://rubygems.org' if possible, or 'http://rubygems.org' if not.

Bundler/OrderedGems.Description: Gems within groups in the Gemfile should be alphabetically sorted.

Gemspec/DuplicatedAssignment.Description: An attribute assignment method calls should be listed only once in a gemspec.

Gemspec/OrderedDependencies.Description: Dependencies in the gemspec should be alphabetically sorted.

Gemspec/RequiredRubyVersion.Description: Checks that `required_ruby_version` of gemspec and `TargetRubyVersion` of .rubocop.yml are equal.

Layout/AccessModifierIndentation.Description: Check indentation of private/protected visibility modifiers.

Layout/AlignArray.Description: Align the elements of an array literal if they span more than one line.

Layout/AlignHash.Description: Align the elements of a hash literal if they span more than one line.

Layout/AlignParameters.Description: Align the parameters of a method call if they span more than one line.

Layout/BlockEndNewline.Description: Put end statement of multiline block on its own line.

Layout/CaseIndentation.Description: Indentation of when in a case/when/[else/]end.

Layout/ClosingParenthesisIndentation.Description: Checks the indentation of hanging closing parentheses.

Layout/ConditionPosition.Description: Checks for condition placed in a confusing position relative to the keyword.

Layout/DefEndAlignment.Description: Align ends corresponding to defs correctly.

Layout/DotPosition.Description: Checks the position of the dot in multi-line method calls.

Layout/EmptyLineAfterMagicComment.Description: Add an empty line after magic comments to separate them from code.

Layout/EmptyLines.Description: Don't use several empty lines in a row.

Layout/EmptyLinesAroundAccessModifier.Description: Keep blank lines around access modifiers.

Layout/EmptyLinesAroundArguments.Description: Keeps track of empty lines around method arguments.

Layout/EmptyLinesAroundBeginBody.Description: Keeps track of empty lines around begin-end bodies.

Layout/EmptyLinesAroundBlockBody.Description: Keeps track of empty lines around block bodies.

Layout/EmptyLinesAroundClassBody.Description: Keeps track of empty lines around class bodies.

Layout/EmptyLinesAroundExceptionHandling.Description: Keeps track of empty lines around exception handling keywords.

Layout/EmptyLinesAroundMethodBody.Description: Keeps track of empty lines around method bodies.

Layout/EmptyLinesAroundModuleBody.Description: Keeps track of empty lines around module bodies.

Layout/FirstParameterIndentation.Description: Checks the indentation of the first parameter in a method call.

Layout/IndentArray.Description: Checks the indentation of the first element in an array literal.

Layout/IndentAssignment.Description: Checks the indentation of the first line of the right-hand-side of a multi-line assignment.

Layout/IndentHash.Description: Checks the indentation of the first key in a hash literal.

Layout/IndentHeredoc.Description: This cops checks the indentation of the here document bodies.

Layout/InitialIndentation.Description: Checks the indentation of the first non-blank non-comment line in a file.

Layout/LeadingCommentSpace.Description: Comments should start with a space.

Layout/MultilineArrayBraceLayout.Description: Checks that the closing brace in an array literal is either on the same line as the last array element, or a new line.

Layout/MultilineBlockLayout.Description: Ensures newlines after multiline block do statements.

Layout/MultilineHashBraceLayout.Description: Checks that the closing brace in a hash literal is either on the same line as the last hash element, or a new line.

Layout/MultilineMethodCallBraceLayout.Description: Checks that the closing brace in a method call is either on the same line as the last method argument, or a new line.

Layout/MultilineMethodCallIndentation.Description: Checks indentation of method calls with the dot operator that span more than one line.

Layout/MultilineMethodDefinitionBraceLay.Description: Checks that the closing brace in a method definition is either on the same line as the last method parameter, or a new line.

Layout/MultilineOperationIndentation.Description: Checks indentation of binary operations that span more than one line.

Layout/SpaceAfterMethodName.Description: Do not put a space between a method name and the opening parenthesis in a method definition.

Layout/SpaceAfterNot.Description: Tracks redundant space after the ! operator.

Layout/SpaceAroundBlockParameters.Description: Checks the spacing inside and after block parameters pipes.

Layout/SpaceAroundEqualsInParameterDefau.Description: Checks that the equals signs in parameter default assignments have or don't have surrounding space depending on configuration.

Layout/SpaceAroundKeyword.Description: Use a space around keywords if appropriate.

Layout/SpaceAroundOperators.Description: Use a single space around operators.

Layout/SpaceBeforeBlockBraces.Description: Checks that the left block brace has or doesn't have space before it.

Layout/SpaceBeforeComment.Description: Checks for missing space between code and a comment on the same line.

Layout/SpaceBeforeFirstArg.Description: Checks that exactly one space is used between a method name and the first argument for method calls without parentheses.

Layout/SpaceInLambdaLiteral.Description: Checks for spaces in lambda literals.

Layout/SpaceInsideArrayLiteralBrackets.Description: Checks the spacing inside array literal brackets.

Layout/SpaceInsideArrayPercentLiteral.Description: No unnecessary additional spaces between elements in %i/%w literals.

Layout/SpaceInsideBlockBraces.Description: Checks that block braces have or don't have surrounding space. For blocks taking parameters, checks that the left brace has or doesn't have trailing space.

Layout/SpaceInsideHashLiteralBraces.Description: Use spaces inside hash literal braces - or don't.

Layout/SpaceInsidePercentLiteralDelimite.Description: No unnecessary spaces inside delimiters of %i/%w/%x literals.

Layout/SpaceInsideReferenceBrackets.Description: Checks the spacing inside referential brackets.

Layout/SpaceInsideStringInterpolation.Description: Checks for padding/surrounding spaces inside string interpolation.

Layout/TrailingBlankLines.Description: Checks trailing blank lines and final newline.

Lint/AmbiguousBlockAssociation.Description: Checks for ambiguous block association with method when param passed without parentheses.

Lint/AmbiguousOperator.Description: Checks for ambiguous operators in the first argument of a method invocation without parentheses.

Lint/AmbiguousRegexpLiteral.Description: Checks for ambiguous regexp literals in the first argument of a method invocation without parentheses.

Lint/CircularArgumentReference.Description: Default values in optional keyword arguments and optional ordinal arguments should not refer back to the name of the argument.

Lint/DeprecatedClassMethods.Description: Check for deprecated class method calls.

Lint/DuplicateCaseCondition.Description: Do not repeat values in case conditionals.

Lint/DuplicatedKey.Description: Check for duplicate keys in hash literals.

Lint/EachWithObjectArgument.Description: Check for immutable argument given to each_with_object.

Lint/ElseLayout.Description: Check for odd code arrangement in an else block.

Lint/EmptyWhen.Description: Checks for `when` branches with empty bodies.

Lint/EndInMethod.Description: END blocks should not be placed inside method definitions.

Lint/EnsureReturn.Description: Do not use return in an ensure block.

Lint/FloatOutOfRange.Description: Catches floating-point literals too large or small for Ruby to represent.

Lint/FormatParameterMismatch.Description: The number of parameters to format/sprint must match the fields.

Lint/ImplicitStringConcatenation.Description: Checks for adjacent string literals on the same line, which could better be represented as a single string literal.

Lint/IneffectiveAccessModifier.Description: Checks for attempts to use `private` or `protected` to set the visibility of a class method, which does not work.

Lint/InterpolationCheck.Description: Raise warning for interpolation in single q strs

Lint/LiteralAsCondition.Description: Checks of literals used in conditions.

Lint/LiteralInInterpolation.Description: Checks for literals used in interpolation.

Lint/Loop.Description: Use Kernel#loop with break rather than begin/end/until or begin/end/while for post-loop tests.

Lint/MissingCopEnableDirective.Description: Checks for a `# rubocop:enable` after `# rubocop:disable`

Lint/MultipleCompare.Description: Use `&&` operator to compare multiple value.

Lint/NestedMethodDefinition.Description: Do not use nested method definitions.

Lint/NextWithoutAccumulator.Description: Do not omit the accumulator when calling `next` in a `reduce`/`inject` block.

Lint/NonLocalExitFromIterator.Description: Do not use return in iterator to cause non-local exit.

Lint/OrderedMagicComments.Description: Checks the proper ordering of magic comments and whether a magic comment is not placed before a shebang.

Lint/ParenthesesAsGroupedExpression.Description: Checks for method calls with a space before the opening parenthesis.

Lint/PercentStringArray.Description: Checks for unwanted commas and quotes in %w/%W literals.

Lint/PercentSymbolArray.Description: Checks for unwanted commas and colons in %i/%I literals.

Lint/RandOne.Description: Checks for `rand(1)` calls. Such calls always return `0` and most likely a mistake.

Lint/RegexpAsCondition.Description: Do not use regexp literal as a condition. The regexp literal matches `$_` implicitly.

Lint/RequireParentheses.Description: Use parentheses in the method call to avoid confusion about precedence.

Lint/RescueType.Description: Avoid rescuing from non constants that could result in a `TypeError`.

Lint/ReturnInVoidContext.Description: Checks for return in void context.

Lint/SafeNavigationChain.Description: Do not chain ordinary method call after safe navigation operator.

Lint/SafeNavigationConsistency.Description: Check to make sure that if safe navigation is used for a method call in an `&&` or `||` condition that safe navigation is used for all method calls on that same object.

Lint/ShadowedArgument.Description: Avoid reassigning arguments before they were used.

Lint/ShadowedException.Description: Avoid rescuing a higher level exception before a lower level exception.

Lint/ShadowingOuterLocalVariable.Description: Do not use the same name as outer local variable for block arguments or block local variables.

Lint/StringConversionInInterpolation.Description: Checks for Object#to_s usage in string interpolation.

Lint/UnderscorePrefixedVariableName.Description: Do not use prefix `_` for a variable that is used.

Lint/UnifiedInteger.Description: Use Integer instead of Fixnum or Bignum

Lint/UnneededCopDisableDirective.Description: Checks for rubocop:disable comments that can be removed. Note: this cop is not disabled when disabling all cops. It must be explicitly disabled.

Lint/UnneededCopEnableDirective.Description: Checks for rubocop:enable comments that can be removed.

Lint/UnneededSplatExpansion.Description: Checks for splat unnecessarily being called on literals

Lint/UriEscapeUnescape.Description: `URI.escape` method is obsolete and should not be used. Instead, use `CGI.escape`, `URI.encode_www_form` or `URI.encode_www_form_component` depending on your specific use case. Also `URI.unescape` method is obsolete and should not be used. Instead, use `CGI.unescape`, `URI.decode_www_form` or `URI.decode_www_form_component` depending on your specific use case.

Lint/UselessAssignment.Description: Checks for useless assignment to a local variable.

Lint/UselessComparison.Description: Checks for comparison of something with itself.

Lint/UselessSetterCall.Description: Checks for useless setter call to a local variable.

Lint/Void.Description: Possible use of operator/literal/variable in void context.

Metrics/AbcSize.Description: A calculated magnitude based on number of assignments, branches, and conditions.

Metrics/BlockLength.Description: Avoid long blocks with many lines.

Metrics/ClassLength.Description: Avoid classes longer than 100 lines of code.

Metrics/CyclomaticComplexity.Description: A complexity metric that is strongly correlated to the number of test cases needed to validate a method.

Metrics/MethodLength.Description: Avoid methods longer than 10 lines of code.

Metrics/ModuleLength.Description: Avoid modules longer than 100 lines of code.

Metrics/ParameterLists.Description: Avoid parameter lists longer than three or four parameters.

Metrics/PerceivedComplexity.Description: A complexity metric geared towards measuring complexity for a human reader.

Naming/AccessorMethodName.Description: Check the naming of accessor methods for get_/set_.

Naming/AsciiIdentifiers.Description: Use only ascii symbols in identifiers.

Naming/BinaryOperatorParameterName.Description: When defining binary operators, name the argument other.

Naming/ClassAndModuleCamelCase.Description: Use CamelCase for classes and modules.

Naming/FileName.Description: Use snake_case for source file names.

Naming/HeredocDelimiterCase.Description: Use configured case for heredoc delimiters.

Naming/MemoizedInstanceVariableName.Description: Memoized method name should match memo instance variable name.

Naming/MethodName.Description: Use the configured style when naming methods.

Naming/PredicateName.Description: Check the names of predicate methods.

Naming/UncommunicativeBlockParamName.Description: Checks for block parameter names that contain capital letters, end in numbers, or do not meet a minimal length.

Naming/UncommunicativeMethodParamName.Description: Checks for method parameter names that contain capital letters, end in numbers, or do not meet a minimal length.

Naming/VariableName.Description: Use the configured style when naming variables.

Naming/VariableNumber.Description: Use the configured style when numbering variables.

Performance/CaseWhenSplat.Description: Place `when` conditions that use splat at the end of the list of `when` branches.

Performance/Casecmp.Description: Use `casecmp` rather than `downcase ==`, `upcase ==`, `== downcase`, or `== upcase`..

Performance/CompareWithBlock.Description: Use `sort_by(&:foo)` instead of `sort { |a, b| a.foo <=> b.foo }`.

Performance/EndWith.Description: Use `end_with?` instead of a regex match anchored to the end of a string.

Performance/FixedSize.Description: Do not compute the size of statically sized objects except in constants

Performance/RedundantMatch.Description: Use `=~` instead of `String#match` or `Regexp#match` in a context where the returned `MatchData` is not needed.

Performance/RedundantMerge.Description: Use Hash#[]=, rather than Hash#merge! with a single key-value pair.

Performance/RegexpMatch.Description: Use `match?` instead of `Regexp#match`, `String#match`, `Symbol#match`, `Regexp#===`, or `=~` when `MatchData` is not used.

Performance/Size.Description: Use `size` instead of `count` for counting the number of elements in `Array` and `Hash`.

Performance/StartWith.Description: Use `start_with?` instead of a regex match anchored to the beginning of a string.

Performance/StringReplacement.Description: Use `tr` instead of `gsub` when you are replacing the same number of characters. Use `delete` instead of `gsub` when you are deleting characters.

Performance/UnfreezeString.Description: Use unary plus to get an unfrozen string literal.

Performance/UnneededSort.Description: Use `min` instead of `sort.first`, `max_by` instead of `sort_by...last`, etc.

Rails/ActionFilter.Description: Enforces consistent use of action filter methods.

Rails/ActiveRecordAliases.Description: Avoid Active Record aliases: Use `update` instead of `update_attributes`. Use `update!` instead of `update_attributes!`.

Rails/ActiveSupportAliases.Description: Avoid ActiveSupport aliases of standard ruby methods: `String#starts_with?`, `String#ends_with?`, `Array#append`, `Array#prepend`.

Rails/CreateTableWithTimestamps.Description: Checks the migration for which timestamps are not included when creating a new table.

Rails/Date.Description: Checks the correct usage of date aware methods, such as Date.today, Date.current etc.

Rails/DelegateAllowBlank.Description: Do not use allow_blank as an option to delegate.

Rails/EnumUniqueness.Description: Avoid duplicate integers in hash-syntax `enum` declaration.

Rails/Exit.Description: Favor `fail`, `break`, `return`, etc. over `exit` in application or library code outside of Rake files to avoid exits during unit testing or running in production.

Rails/HasManyOrHasOneDependent.Description: Define the dependent option to the has_many and has_one associations.

Rails/HttpPositionalArguments.Description: Use keyword arguments instead of positional arguments in http method calls.

Rails/HttpStatus.Description: Enforces use of symbolic or numeric value to define HTTP status.

Rails/InverseOf.Description: Checks for associations where the inverse cannot be determined automatically.

Rails/LexicallyScopedActionFilter.Description: Checks that methods specified in the filter's `only` or `except` options are explicitly defined in the controller.

Rails/NotNullColumn.Description: Do not add a NOT NULL column without a default value

Rails/Output.Description: Checks for calls to puts, print, etc.

Rails/OutputSafety.Description: The use of `html_safe` or `raw` may be a security risk.

Rails/PluralizationGrammar.Description: Checks for incorrect grammar when using methods like `3.day.ago`.

Rails/Presence.Description: Checks code that can be written more easily using `Object#presence` defined by Active Support.

Rails/ReadWriteAttribute.Description: Checks for read_attribute(:attr) and write_attribute(:attr, val).

Rails/RelativeDateConstant.Description: Do not assign relative date to constants.

Rails/ReversibleMigration.Description: Checks whether the change method of the migration file is reversible.

Rails/SafeNavigation.Description: Use Ruby's safe navigation operator (`&.`) instead of `try!`

Rails/ScopeArgs.Description: Checks the arguments of ActiveRecord scopes.

Rails/SkipsModelValidations.Description: Use methods that skips model validations with caution. See reference for more information.

Rails/TimeZone.Description: Checks the correct usage of time zone aware methods.

Rails/UniqBeforePluck.Description: Prefer the use of uniq or distinct before pluck.

Security/Eval.Description: The use of eval represents a serious security risk.

Security/JSONLoad.Description: Prefer usage of `JSON.parse` over `JSON.load` due to potential security issues. See reference for more information.

Security/MarshalLoad.Description: Avoid using of `Marshal.load` or `Marshal.restore` due to potential security issues. See reference for more information.

Security/Open.Description: The use of Kernel#open represents a serious security risk.

Security/YAMLLoad.Description: Prefer usage of `YAML.safe_load` over `YAML.load` due to potential security issues. See reference for more information.

Style/AsciiComments.Description: Use only ascii symbols in comments.

Style/BarePercentLiterals.Description: Checks if usage of %() or %Q() matches configuration.

Style/BeginBlock.Description: Avoid the use of BEGIN blocks.

Style/BlockDelimiters.Description: Avoid using {...} for multi-line blocks (multiline chaining is always ugly). Prefer {...} over do...end for single-line blocks.

Style/BracesAroundHashParameters.Description: Enforce braces style around hash parameters.

Style/CaseEquality.Description: Avoid explicit use of the case equality operator(===).

Style/CharacterLiteral.Description: Checks for uses of character literals.

Style/ClassAndModuleChildren.Description: Checks style of children classes and modules.

Style/ClassMethods.Description: Use self when defining module/class methods.

Style/ClassVars.Description: Avoid the use of class variables.

Style/ColonMethodCall.Description: Do not use :: for method call.

Style/ColonMethodDefinition.Description: Do not use :: for defining class methods.

Style/CommentAnnotation.Description: Checks formatting of special comments (TODO, FIXME, OPTIMIZE, HACK, REVIEW).

Style/CommentedKeyword.Description: Do not place comments on the same line as certain keywords.

Style/ConditionalAssignment.Description: Use the return value of `if` and `case` statements for assignment to a variable and variable comparison instead of assigning that variable inside of each branch.

Style/DateTime.Description: Use Date or Time over DateTime.

Style/DefWithParentheses.Description: Use def with parentheses when there are arguments.

Style/Dir.Description: Use the `__dir__` method to retrieve the canonicalized absolute path to the current file.

Style/DoubleNegation.Description: Checks for uses of double negation (!!).

Style/EachForSimpleLoop.Description: Use `Integer#times` for a simple loop which iterates a fixed number of times.

Style/EmptyBlockParameter.Description: Omit pipes for empty block parameters.

Style/EmptyCaseCondition.Description: Avoid empty condition in case statements.

Style/EmptyLambdaParameter.Description: Omit parens for empty lambda parameters.

Style/EmptyMethod.Description: Checks the formatting of empty method definitions.

Style/Encoding.Description: Use UTF-8 as the source file encoding.

Style/EndBlock.Description: Avoid the use of END blocks.

Style/EvalWithLocation.Description: Pass `__FILE__` and `__LINE__` to `eval` method, as they are used by backtraces.

Style/EvenOdd.Description: Favor the use of Integer#even? && Integer#odd?

Style/For.Description: Checks use of for or each in multiline loops.

Style/FormatString.Description: Enforce the use of Kernel#sprintf, Kernel#format or String#%.

Style/FormatStringToken.Description: Use a consistent style for format string tokens.

Style/FrozenStringLiteralComment.Description: Add the frozen_string_literal comment to the top of files to help transition from Ruby 2.3.0 to Ruby 3.0.

Style/GuardClause.Description: Check for conditionals that can be replaced with guard clauses

Style/HashSyntax.Description: Prefer Ruby 1.9 hash syntax { a: 1, b: 2 } over 1.8 syntax { :a => 1, :b => 2 }.

Style/IdenticalConditionalBranches.Description: Checks that conditional statements do not have an identical line at the end of each branch, which can validly be moved out of the conditional.

Style/IfInsideElse.Description: Finds if nodes inside else, which can be converted to elsif.

Style/IfUnlessModifier.Description: Favor modifier if/unless usage when you have a single-line body.

Style/IfUnlessModifierOfIfUnless.Description: Avoid modifier if/unless usage on conditionals.

Style/IfWithSemicolon.Description: Do not use if x; .... Use the ternary operator instead.

Style/InverseMethods.Description: Use the inverse method instead of `!.method` if an inverse method is defined.

Style/Lambda.Description: Use the new lambda literal syntax for single-line blocks.

Style/LineEndConcatenation.Description: Use \ instead of + or << to concatenate two string literals at line end.

Style/MethodCallWithoutArgsParentheses.Description: Do not use parentheses for method calls with no arguments.

Style/MethodDefParentheses.Description: Checks if the method definitions have or don't have parentheses.

Style/MinMax.Description: Use `Enumerable#minmax` instead of `Enumerable#min` and `Enumerable#max` in conjunction.'

Style/MixinGrouping.Description: Checks for grouping of mixins in `class` and `module` bodies.

Style/MixinUsage.Description: Checks that `include`, `extend` and `prepend` exists at the top level.

Style/ModuleFunction.Description: Checks for usage of `extend self` in modules.

Style/MultilineIfModifier.Description: Only use if/unless modifiers on single line statements.

Style/MultilineIfThen.Description: Do not use then for multi-line if/unless.

Style/MultilineMemoization.Description: Wrap multiline memoizations in a `begin` and `end` block.

Style/MultilineTernaryOperator.Description: Avoid multi-line ?: (the ternary operator); use if/unless instead.

Style/MultipleComparison.Description: Avoid comparing a variable with multiple items in a conditional, use Array#include? instead.

Style/MutableConstant.Description: Do not assign mutable objects to constants.

Style/NegatedIf.Description: Favor unless over if for negative conditions (or control flow or).

Style/NegatedWhile.Description: Favor until over while for negative conditions.

Style/NestedParenthesizedCalls.Description: Parenthesize method calls which are nested inside the argument list of another parenthesized method call.

Style/NestedTernaryOperator.Description: Use one expression per branch in a ternary operator.

Style/Next.Description: Use `next` to skip iteration instead of a condition at the end.

Style/NumericLiteralPrefix.Description: Use smallcase prefixes for numeric literals.

Style/NumericLiterals.Description: Add underscores to large numeric literals to improve their readability.

Style/NumericPredicate.Description: Checks for the use of predicate- or comparison methods for numeric comparisons.

Style/OneLineConditional.Description: Favor the ternary operator(?:) over if/then/else/end constructs.

Style/OptionalArguments.Description: Checks for optional arguments that do not appear at the end of the argument list

Style/OrAssignment.Description: Recommend usage of double pipe equals (||=) where applicable.

Style/ParallelAssignment.Description: Check for simple usages of parallel assignment. It will only warn when the number of variables matches on both sides of the assignment.

Style/ParenthesesAroundCondition.Description: Don't use parentheses around the condition of an if/unless/while.

Style/PercentQLiterals.Description: Checks if uses of %Q/%q match the configured preference.

Style/PreferredHashMethods.Description: Checks use of `has_key?` and `has_value?` Hash methods.

Style/RaiseArgs.Description: Checks the arguments passed to raise/fail.

Style/RandomWithOffset.Description: Prefer to use ranges when generating random numbers instead of integers with offsets.

Style/RedundantBegin.Description: Don't use begin blocks when they are not needed.

Style/RedundantConditional.Description: Don't return true/false from a conditional.

Style/RedundantException.Description: Checks for an obsolete RuntimeException argument in raise/fail.

Style/RedundantFreeze.Description: Checks usages of Object#freeze on immutable objects.

Style/RedundantParentheses.Description: Checks for parentheses that seem not to serve any purpose.

Style/RedundantReturn.Description: Don't use return where it's not required.

Style/RedundantSelf.Description: Don't use self where it's not needed.

Style/RescueModifier.Description: Avoid using rescue in its modifier form.

Style/RescueStandardError.Description: Avoid rescuing without specifying an error class.

Style/SafeNavigation.Description: This cop transforms usages of a method call safeguarded by a check for the existence of the object to safe navigation (`&.`).

Style/SelfAssignment.Description: Checks for places where self-assignment shorthand should have been used.

Style/Semicolon.Description: Don't use semicolons to terminate expressions.

Style/SignalException.Description: Checks for proper usage of fail and raise.

Style/StabbyLambdaParentheses.Description: Check for the usage of parentheses around stabby lambda arguments.

Style/StringLiterals.Description: Checks if uses of quotes match the configured preference.

Style/StringLiteralsInInterpolation.Description: Checks if uses of quotes inside expressions in interpolated strings match the configured preference.

Style/SymbolArray.Description: Use %i or %I for arrays of symbols.

Style/SymbolLiteral.Description: Use plain symbols instead of string symbols when possible.

Style/SymbolProc.Description: Use symbols as procs instead of blocks when possible.

Style/TernaryParentheses.Description: Checks for use of parentheses around ternary conditions.

Style/TrailingBodyOnClass.Description: Class body goes below class statement.

Style/TrailingBodyOnModule.Description: Module body goes below module statement.

Style/TrailingCommaInArguments.Description: Checks for trailing comma in argument lists.

Style/TrailingCommaInArrayLiteral.Description: Checks for trailing comma in array literals.

Style/TrailingCommaInHashLiteral.Description: Checks for trailing comma in hash literals.

Style/TrailingMethodEndStatement.Description: Checks for trailing end statement on line of method body.

Style/TrailingUnderscoreVariable.Description: Checks for the usage of unneeded trailing underscores at the end of parallel variable assignment.

Style/TrivialAccessors.Description: Prefer attr_* methods to trivial readers/writers.

Style/UnlessElse.Description: Do not use unless with else. Rewrite these with the positive case first.

Style/UnneededCapitalW.Description: Checks for %W when interpolation is not needed.

Style/UnneededInterpolation.Description: Checks for strings that are just an interpolated expression.

Style/UnneededPercentQ.Description: Checks for %q/%Q when single quotes or double quotes would do.

Style/UnpackFirst.Description: Checks for accessing the first element of `String#unpack` instead of using `unpack1`

Style/VariableInterpolation.Description: Don't interpolate global, instance and class variables directly in strings.

Style/WhenThen.Description: Use when x then ... for one-line cases.

Style/WhileUntilDo.Description: Checks for redundant do after while or until.

Style/WhileUntilModifier.Description: Favor modifier while/until usage when you have a single-line body.

Style/WordArray.Description: Use %w or %W for arrays of words.

Style/YodaCondition.Description: Do not use literals as the first operand of a comparison.

Style/ZeroLengthPredicate.Description: Use #empty? when testing for objects of length 0.

adoption.email_sent: An email has been sent to the owner of %{cookbook_or_tool}, alerting them of your interest.

adoption.down: %{name} is no longer up for adoption.

user.must_be_signed_in: You must be signed in to do that.
user.not_found: %{name} was not found in Supermarket.  Make sure the user exists in Supermarket before making it an admin.
user.unsuccessful_promotion_message: %{name} was not able to be promoted to an admin at this time.  Please try again later.

account.already_connected: The %{provider} account (%{username}) you are trying to link is already linked to another Supermarket user.

badge.unsuccessful_grant_message: %{grantee} was not able to be granted the %{name} badge.

collaborator.owner_changed: You successfully transferred ownership of %{resource} to %{user}.

ownership_transfer.invite_accepted: You are the new owner of %{cookbook}.

cookbook.deprecate_with_deprecated_failure: This cookbook cannot be deprecated in favor of a deprecated cookbook.
cookbook.updated: The %{name} cookbook has been successfully updated.
cookbook.version_not_found: Version %{version} of %{name} cookbook was not found.
cookbook.quality_metric_pass_rate_tip: the percentage of passing quality metrics

decline.success: %{username} has not been authorized to contribute on behalf of %{organization}.

already.declined: %{username} has already been declined authorization to contribute on behalf of %{organization}.

fieri.not_enabled: Quality metrics feature (fieri) is not enabled.

scheduled.multiple: Scheduled quality metric evaluations for %{count} cookbook(s).

icla.successful_signature: You successfully signed the ICLA. Thank you!
icla.duplicate_signature: You have already signed the ICLA. You can view and update your signature within Manage Profile.

accept.duplicate: You have already signed %{organization} CCLA. Please sign in as a different user to accept the invitation. If this invitation was sent in error, no action is required.

no_cookbooks.collaborates: %{username} does not collaborate on any cookbooks.

repositories.evaluate: Curry is now evaluating all open Pull Requests on %{name}.

subscribe.failure: That repository does not exist on GitHub.
subscribe.success: Supermarket is now monitoring this repository.

unsubscribe.failure: There was an issue unsubscribing Supermarket from the repo.
unsubscribe.success: Supermarket is no longer monitoring this repo.

error_messages.unauthorized_post_error: You are not authorized to POST to this end-point

To become authorized to contribute, you will need to sign the Contributor License Agreement (CLA) as an individual or on behalf of your company.
